summary: The bill, officially titled the Taskforce for Recognizing and Averting Payment Scams Act or the TRAPS Act, establishes a task force under the Secretary of the Treasury to combat payment scams. The task force will include representatives from various federal agencies, financial institutions, and consumer groups. It will examine scam trends, identify prevention methods, develop educational programs, and make recommendations for legislative or regulatory changes. The Task Force is required to meet regularly, issue reports, and will sunset three years after its initial report.
